review: After 18 months of antibiotics,anti fungal, sputum and blood test and steroids for aspergillosis,I was prescribed itraconazole capsules two months ago.I am feeling better already and am hoping there is finally some relief. Less coughing sleeping better.

Was put on itraconazole after numerous other antifungal medications failed and it was found that I have invasive aspergillosis. I’m a type 1 diabetic (aka immunocompromised) and so far this is the only medication that has worked for this infection. I have yet to finish the course of medication but I am already feeling so much better. I’m shocked because all other meds have failed.

I was prescribed this medicine as I had become increasingly ill despite countless courses of oral and IV antibiotics and oral steroids.  They discovered that I had aspergillosis and I have now been on this medication for almost 18 months.  I did try to stop it after about 9 months as I was advised it was very toxic to the liver but I became very ill again.  It has quite literally saved my life & I can recommend it based on my own experience,
